chess

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    An 8x8 chess game board. The columns (i.e. file) are labeled from "a" to "h" starting from left to right. The rows (i.e. rank) are labeled as "8" to "1 starting from top to bottom. The square "a1" which is at the lower left hand corner of the game board is always a black square. Queens always start on the "d" file.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Toni Au

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Default constructor.
      Board(Board copyFromBoard)
      This version of a constructor is used to create a clone of a game board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Default constructor. This constructor will initialize a new chess game board and place all game pieces at their starting position.

      • Board

        public Board(Board copyFromBoard)
        This version of a constructor is used to create a clone of a game board. All pieces and their current locations are copied to a new board.
        Parameters:
        copyFromBoard - A game board to copy from.

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show()
        Display the game board and all the pieces

      • move

        public boolean move(java.lang.String fromLoc,
                    java.lang.String toLoc)
        Move a chess piece from one location to another location on the game board.
        Parameters:
        fromLoc - The starting location of a game piece
        toLoc - The destination of a game piece
        Returns:

        A boolean return value. If this is an illegal move, this function will return "false". Otherwise, a "true" is returned.
